commitMessage.title: Add Dashboard with favorites and recent notes
commitMessage.body:
Implement new Dashboard route as home page with favorite notes and Last 3 modified notes.

New Features:
- Dashboard tab with 'home' icon as new index route
- Favorites section (no header) for quick access to favorited notes
- Last 3 section showing most recently modified non-favorite notes
- Empty state cards for new users with helpful prompts
- 'Add to Favorites' action in popup menu (...) and modal
- Database column is_favorite with index for performance

Tab Restructure:
- Renamed app/(tabs)/index.tsx â†’ notes.tsx
- Created new app/(tabs)/index.tsx for Dashboard
- Updated tab navigation: Dashboard â†’ Info â†’ Notes â†’ Settings

Service Layer:
- toggleFavorite(noteId, isFavorite) - Update favorite status
- getFavoriteNotes() - Query favorited notes
- getRecentNonFavoriteNotes(limit) - Query recent non-favorites

User Experience:
- Star icon (star-border/star) indicates favorite status
- Toast confirmation on favorite toggle
- User stays on current page when favoriting (not redirected)
- Notes in favorites excluded from Last 3 (no duplication)
- Empty state cards disappear when user adds content

Testing:
- Database migration tested with index creation
- Service methods query correctly with RLS
- Dashboard loads favorites and recent notes
- Empty state displays and dismisses correctly
- Favorite actions work in both menu and modal
- Tab navigation routes to correct pages

potentialIssues.issue: Missing database index for Last 3 query
potentialIssues.description: getRecentNonFavoriteNotes() queries non-favorites sorted by updated_at, but no index exists for this
potentialIssues.solution: Add second index: CREATE INDEX idx_notes_user_recent ON public.notes(user_id, updated_at DESC) WHERE is_favorite = false;
potentialIssues.impact: Performance degradation on Last 3 query as notes table grows

potentialIssues.description: Dashboard needs to refresh when user favorites/unfavorites from Notes page or creates/edits notes, but refresh mechanism not specified
solutions: Use navigation focus event to reload data when Dashboard tab gains focus
Add onFavoriteToggle callback that triggers Dashboard refresh via context/event emitter
Implement real-time subscriptions for automatic updates
potentialIssues.recommendation: Use navigation focus event (simplest, most reliable)

potentialIssues.issue: Empty state logic may be too strict
potentialIssues.description: Current: favoriteNotes.length === 0 && recentNotes.length === 0 - Both cards disappear together. If user has 1 favorite but no other notes, empty state won't show.
potentialIssues.alternative: Show card 1 only if favoriteNotes.length === 0, show card 2 only if recentNotes.length === 0
potentialIssues.currentBehavior: Intentional - both cards disappear when ANY content exists
potentialIssues.verdict: Current approach is acceptable but worth discussing with designer

potentialIssues.description: What happens when user has 50+ favorites? Should Dashboard limit display or show all with scroll?
potentialIssues.recommendation: Either: (1) Show all favorites with scroll, or (2) Add limit to getFavoriteNotes() and 'View All' link
potentialIssues.preferredApproach: Show all with scroll (simpler, matches user expectation)

recommendedAdjustments.reasoning: Optimizes getRecentNonFavoriteNotes() query as notes table scales
